section.hand:
To my L. T
re
r May 21 1591.

addressleaf.section:
Belgia 1591 21 May To my L Trea
s

page.lettertext:
May it please yo
r
good L. I declared in my last
the 17
th
of this moneth, what practise was used by
S
r
Francis Vere
, wh
r
by he surprised
e sconce before
Zutphen
c
r
taine of his souldiers were disguised like boores & boorins
who being assisted w
th
e company of contrey boores, & fayning
to runne for succor to
e sconse bringing w
th
them corne &
oth
r
vittailes, as they had often don before, were Rxd by
e
garrison, & followed w
th
such diligence by S
r
Francis Vere
as all w
th
in
e forte w
ch
were not passing 30
sons were
put to
e sword &
e fort taken, this was don
e 14 of
this p
nt
in
e morning, The night following he disposed
his troupes to enclose
e towne of Zutphen & sent w
th
all to
Count Maurice
, being then at
Utrecht
to second him p
nt
ly w
th
farder forces, who caused 3 cornet
of horse, & 11 enseignes
of foote to marche w
th
all diligence toward
Zutphen, & hee
himself followed
e next daie after, w
th
e rest of his tro upes
& provision of shippes, bridges & rowe boates. The same
daie
e Enemy in a furie attempted
e recovery of
e forte
but failed of his purpose. Also those of
Deventer
endevour
ed
to relieve
e towne of Zutphen w
th
100 horse laden w
th
corne
were overthrowen by o
r
souldiers, who had also
e spoile of
theyr corne & horse. Howbeit
e
Count of Oversteine
was
going to make a bravado before
e Towne, was overtaken by
an Ambushe of
e Ennemy & shott in
e head wherof he died
p
nt
ly. S
r
Francis Vere being w
th
him escaped happely, but his
horse was stricken. By this time it is thought that
e Count
hath planted his Artillery, to batter
e Towne, w
ch
is all
e
occurrence w
ch
is yet at
e Hage.
May 21 1591.
